title: ALEC Registers as Federal Nonprofit and Moves to Washington D.C.
summary: The American Legislative Exchange Council officially registered as a federal nonprofit agency in 1975 with support from the American Conservative Union, moving from Chicago to Washington D.C. under Paul Weyrich's leadership. This transition marked ALEC's evolution from a state legislative caucus to a national corporate-legislative coordination mechanism.

sources.title: ALEC: 50 Years of Attacking Environmental Protection
